column4: can a vpn hide ur internet activity from a network administrator?
well, aside from the fact that it will be obvious, yes.
your network admin will be able to see lots of encrypted garbage traffic. It will be obvious that it's a SSH tunnel or VPN connection but they won't be able to see what you're doing.
They can still also guess based on the bandwidth shape that you're streaming/torrenting but that would still be hard.
do u know of a tutorial i could use to set that up?
depends, exactly what are you triyng to do? There's lots of different ways of going about it.
i'm trying to torrent annonymously and also hide internet activity
Do you trust your endpoint?
do you have a VPN provider in mind? Or do you have a PC at home that you trust as safe?
to do a VPN, you need someone who's going to provide you with an endpoint, eventually your torrent has to connect to the wide internet.
I think ThePirateBay runs a VPN, I don't know if it's any good or how expensive it is.
is this making sense? I can try to find a picture if it would hlep.
so i would set up my desktop at home as the client?
What internet traffic are you trying to hide? Home Computer -> internet? Laptop->Internet? Phone->Internet?
yes, but I'm not sure you understand how this works. Let me show you :)
[Your Computer (96.255.210.90)] ----VPN---> [Ipredator account (1.2.3.4)]  -----> Internet.
this way, all of your traffic to the Internet comes out of the IP Address 1.2.3.4. The "Internet" at large doesn't know where that traffic originally came from.
it's not softare, it's a VPN account on a remote computer.
if the software was on your computer, it would still come from your IP Address, and thus not be anonymous.

the internet isn't an anonymous place. When content goes out to the Internet, it has to originate somewhere. It's basically like driving to another town to mail a package anonymously... You're sending your traffic to another server and then it sends it out and pretends to be the origin to hide your identity.
the picture here isn't fantastic, but it might help: https://www.ipredator.se/?lang=en
if you make a VPN connection to an iPredator server, it MIGHT be encrypted... it depends on what type of VPN it is. I believe all are encrypted by default.
